modName: Vivid Ender ENB - a preset for Enderal
summary: This ENB preset is especially made for Enderal and the enderal Weathers.
descriptionHtml:
[center][font=century gothic]
[img]http://www.brevis-design.de/extern/enderlogo.png[/img]
[size=5]Welcome to Vivid Ender ENB - a ENB preset for Enderal[/size]

[img]http://hikaru.at/button/overview.png[/img]

[size=3]This ENB preset is especially suited to be used, and only to be used with Enderal.Â 
It supports all Weathers that come with Enderal and adds tons of ENB effects to the Visuals.[/size]

[img]http://hikaru.at/button/features.png[/img][/font][/center][font=century gothic]

[img]http://hikaru.at/s.gif[/img]- Supports all Weathers of Enderal
[img]http://hikaru.at/s.gif[/img]- Advanced Configureable shaders like, sharpening, letterbox, vignette, saturation, Nighteye and much more for you to tweak

[img]http://hikaru.at/s.gif[/img][b]Future Updates and considderings[/b]
[img]http://hikaru.at/s.gif[/img]- Revamped enderal Fog that pushes the fog backwards for more clear sight
[img]http://hikaru.at/s.gif[/img]- advanced lens effects like dirt, rain, frost

[center][img]http://hikaru.at/button/install.png[/img][/center]
[img]http://hikaru.at/s.gif[/img]1. ENB Setup: Install The latest ENB to the Skyrim installation directory.
[img]http://hikaru.at/s.gif[/img]In short: you just need the d3d9.dll and enbhost.exe from the wrapper directory.
[img]http://hikaru.at/s.gif[/img]Copy those two files to your skyrim Main Directory

[img]http://hikaru.at/s.gif[/img]2. ENB Preset Files install:
[img]http://hikaru.at/s.gif[/img]Copy the content of the Vivid Ender ENB files to your Skyrim directory.
[img]http://hikaru.at/s.gif[/img]Make sure you do not overwrite the enblocal.ini file if you already tweaked one for yourself.
[img]http://hikaru.at/s.gif[/img]Alternatively you can use the included "enblocal.ini" from the optionals directory (read the readme!)
[img]http://hikaru.at/s.gif[/img]select prefered "optionals" from Preset directory (e.g. letterbox/vignette)

[img]http://hikaru.at/s.gif[/img][b][u]3. IMPORTANT SETTINGS[/u][/b]
[img]http://hikaru.at/s.gif[/img]set "RemoveBlur=true" in enblocal.ini (Enderal has a VERY strong IS DoF, blurry mess with ENB, set as you see fit, maybe you like it?)
[img]http://hikaru.at/s.gif[/img]No Need for Static DoF! ENB uses "depth sharpening", distance does not get sharpened, it's like a subtle static distant DoF
[img]http://hikaru.at/s.gif[/img]Disable "OneTweak" in Enderal Launcher, Seems to cause issues with ENB

[img]http://hikaru.at/s.gif[/img]4. Skyrimprefs.ini Please make sure you have all nessesary Skyrim Prefs set correctly in your skyrimprefs.ini
[img]http://hikaru.at/s.gif[/img]Please try using the included ini files in optionals. Many people have wrong skies, blurry shadows and so on in Enderal
[img]http://hikaru.at/s.gif[/img](like seen in many screenshots) because their ini files from skyrim are messed up / have different values. Maybe do a compare!
[img]http://hikaru.at/s.gif[/img][Display]
[img]http://hikaru.at/s.gif[/img]bFloatPointRenderTarget=1
[img]http://hikaru.at/s.gif[/img]bTreesReceiveShadows=1
[img]http://hikaru.at/s.gif[/img]bDrawLandShadows=1
[img]http://hikaru.at/s.gif[/img]bShadowsOnGrass=1
[img]http://hikaru.at/s.gif[/img]bDeferredShadows=1
[img]http://hikaru.at/s.gif[/img]fGamma=1.0000
[img]http://hikaru.at/s.gif[/img]iMultiSample=0 // turns off the game's multi-sampling AA
[img]http://hikaru.at/s.gif[/img]bTransparencyMultisampling=0 // turns off transparency AA
[img]http://hikaru.at/s.gif[/img][Imagespace]
[img]http://hikaru.at/s.gif[/img]bDoDepthOfField=1
[img]http://hikaru.at/s.gif[/img]iRadialBlurLevel=1
[img]http://hikaru.at/s.gif[/img]Also disable Antialiasing and Anisoptric Filtering in your Enderal prefs that are accessible via the launcher.

[center][img]http://hikaru.at/button/credits.png[/img][/center]
[img]http://hikaru.at/s.gif[/img]MANNY MANNY thanks for the awesome Pictures taken by EMS60 so i could publish this mod! [img]http://www.gifs.net/Animation11/Everything_Else/Love/small_heart.gif[/img]
[img]http://hikaru.at/s.gif[/img]Thanks to Kyo for letting me use his bloom code, you are a gentleman and a blessing
[img]http://hikaru.at/s.gif[/img]prod80 for lots of code base, skyrim modding would not be the same without you
[img]http://hikaru.at/s.gif[/img]your works still echo, we miss you here... "all the best" ;)
[img]http://hikaru.at/s.gif[/img]Boris of course, for the tool that made it all possible and robbed years of my life, thank you :)
[img]http://hikaru.at/s.gif[/img]additional credits inlcuded in files

[center][/center]
[/font]
author: Mangaclub and Benhat

files.name: Vivid Ender ENB
files.changelogHtml:
added / tweaked more visual shader enhancements.
Black fadeouts work much better now

files.name: Vivid Ender ENB
files.changelogHtml:
-Refined lighting values and added shader limitations for bloom and other imagespaces so certain interiors with extreme imagespace values are now rendered much better
- optimized Imagebasedlighting
-Added clean skyrimprefs and Ini files as example
-Made enblocal optional

files.name: Vivid Ender ENB
files.changelogHtml:
completely changed a lot of things.
much better balance now.
things look a lot different now again! hope for the better for you too!
TODO: still need to work on individual weathers

files.name: Vivid Ender ENB
files.changelogHtml: complete rework again and new look

files.name: Vivid Ender ENB
files.changelogHtml:
letterbox/vignette is now off by default (enable by using the optionals)
enabled shadowqualityfix
a bit less vibrance/saturation
worked on some weathers
balanced nights of some weathers
